Question: Nevertheless, the poet Ellery Channing reported that this person "has suffered much living in this place".
Hints: This person and his family moved to a small red farmhouse near Lenox, Massachusetts at the end of March 1850.
Though the family enjoyed the scenery of The Berkshires, this person did not enjoy the winters in their small red house.
In fact, it was Fields who convinced this person to turn The Scarlet Letter into a novel rather than a short story.
